meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of the simplest form of sponge, with a tubular body perforated by pores through which water enters.
meanings.sent1: The asconoid sponge had a basic tubular body with pores for water entry.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the asconoid structure of the sponge carefully.
meanings.sent3: The asconoid sponge decided to throw a party for all its pore friends.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like an asconoid sponge, absorbing every detail around her.
meanings.sent5: The asconoid nature of the sponge made it easy for water to flow through.

meanings.definition: A sponge of the class Asconoida, typically having a simple tubular body with a single opening.
meanings.sent1: The asconoid was the most common sponge found in the ocean.
meanings.sent2: She marveled at the beauty of the asconoid sponge she found while snorkeling.
meanings.sent3: The asconoid sponge won the award for the most punctual marine creature.
meanings.sent4: His heart felt like an asconoid, with a single opening for emotions to flow in and out.
meanings.sent5: The asconoid sponge stood out among the other sea creatures with its unique structure.
